definition: male/staminate/grand/imposing/powerful/mighty/person or state having great power and influence

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: I'm no orator , as he is.
sentences.chinese: 我不善言语，而他却是位雄辩家。

sentences.english: He was first and foremost a fiery orator in the 19th century mold.
sentences.chinese: 他却是19世纪中期首屈一指的富于热情的雄辩家。

sentences.english: The auctioneer was a silver-tongued man from Alabama.
sentences.chinese: 那位拍卖商是一位出生于亚拉巴马州的雄辩家。

definition: sophist/one who relies on specious arguments
Socrates (469-399 BC), Greek philosopher/José Sócrates (1957-), prime minister of Portugal (2005-2011)
Marcus Tullius Cicero (106-43 BC), famous Roman politician, orator and philosopher, murdered at the orders of Marc Anthony
jurist/member of the pre-Han legalist school
